thread.title: Tony-winning Irish playwright Brian Friel dies at 86
thread.title_full: Tony-winning Irish playwright Brian Friel dies at 86

title: Tony-winning Irish playwright Brian Friel dies at 86
text: > Entertainment Tony-winning Irish playwright Brian Friel dies at 86 FILE - This is a June 16, 2009 file photo of playwright Brian Friel, right, holding his University College Dublin Ulysses Medal, with Irish poet Seamus Heaney in Dublin. Authorities say Brian Friel, the Tony Award-winning playwright who created ``Dancing at Lughnasa’’ and more than 30 other plays, has died at the age of 86. The Arts Council of Ireland says in a statement that Friel died Friday Oct. 2, 2015. The cause of death was not given. (Julien Behal/PA, File via AP)
